title: (x) Brad Martin Painting logo uncommon blocky sans - Chicago {Eric Hague}
content:
Is this an uncommon font or is somebody just having a bad case of the mondays?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122053516im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Brad%20Martin_font_4963.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Script from WWD Accessories Magazine - OPLord Swash (Lys Calligraphic) {Tom Harpole (Mike F)}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122053516/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48064 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can you help me identify this font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122053516/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48072 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jrgott

comments.content: Just a bad case of the [Chicago](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122053516/http:/www.identifont.com/list?2+chicago+2+902+395+DSW+124+1O4+0)s.
I would not mind if Chicago, Peignot, and Bauhaus were put into a rocket and fired into the sun.
Excellent Robert, have added it to my favaorites ;)
Excellent Robert, have added it to my favorites ;)
Well I just emailed him asking who his desinger was... I’m hoping he’ll do my personal branding...
Wish I could say this is my work ;) but listen, I just do what I’m told. Thanks for your help!
Much prefer the embossed, drop-shadowed, puke-colored version.
